intro: Ardisia lurida, commonly known as the glossy abutilon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. It produces bright red, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for various birds and small mammals. Ardisia lurida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
